prompts.phrase: Do you have this in a smaller size?
prompts.explanation: Used when asking if a product is available in a smaller package or portion.
prompts.prompt: A male customer holding a large product package in a supermarket aisle.
prompts.negative_prompt: Crowded aisles, promotional banners, self-checkout machines.

prompts.phrase: Can I get a price check on this?
prompts.explanation: Used when the price of an item is unclear or missing, and a store employee needs to verify it.
prompts.prompt: A male cashier holding an item in a supermarket
prompts.negative_prompt: Long lines, unrelated store sections, overly complex backgrounds.

prompts.phrase: Is this on sale, or is that the regular price?
prompts.explanation: A question to clarify whether an item is discounted or at its normal price.
prompts.prompt: A male customer holding a product in a supermarket
prompts.negative_prompt: Self-checkout, digital price displays, busy store aisles.

prompts.phrase: Do you have any more of these in the back?
prompts.explanation: A common question when a product seems to be out of stock on the shelves.
prompts.prompt: A male customer looking an empty shelf in a supermarket aisle.
prompts.negative_prompt: Fully stocked shelves, checkout lines, promotional posters.

prompts.phrase: I'll just grab one more thing!
prompts.explanation: Said when a customer leaves the checkout line briefly to pick up an additional item.
prompts.prompt: A male customer turning away from the checkout counter in a supermarket.
prompts.negative_prompt: Long lines, cluttered shelves, unrelated store sections.

prompts.phrase: Could I get cash back with this?
prompts.explanation: Asked when paying with a debit card and requesting extra cash along with the purchase.
prompts.prompt: A male customer at supermarket checkout handing a debit card.

prompts.phrase: Do you have a loyalty card?
prompts.explanation: A question cashiers often ask customers to see if they want to use a rewards program.
prompts.prompt: A smiling male cashier speaking to a customer in a supermarket checkout line
prompts.negative_prompt: Busy lines, digital-only transactions, unrelated store sections.

prompts.explanation: A standard question asked by cashiers after a purchase.
prompts.prompt: A male cashier handing a small paper receipt to a customer in a supermarket.
prompts.negative_prompt: Self-checkout, overly cluttered counters, unrelated backgrounds.

prompts.phrase: The line is moving so slowly today.
prompts.explanation: A casual remark about a long or slow-moving checkout line.
prompts.prompt: An annoyed male customer waiting in a long checkout line in a supermarket.
prompts.negative_prompt: Short lines, empty store aisles, unrelated products.

prompts.phrase: I'll just pay with my phone.
prompts.explanation: Used when choosing to use a mobile payment method instead of cash or cards.
prompts.prompt: A male customer holding a smartphone near a payment terminal in a supermarket.
prompts.negative_prompt: Cash transactions, paper receipts, busy backgrounds.

prompts.phrase: Oh, I forgot my reusable bags!
prompts.explanation: A common realization when customers remember they left their shopping bags at home or in the car.
prompts.prompt: A male customer at supermarket checkout with a surprised expression
prompts.negative_prompt: Plastic bags, self-checkout, unrelated store sections.

prompts.phrase: Let's split this bill in half.
prompts.explanation: A phrase used when two people want to divide the cost of groceries equally at checkout.
prompts.prompt: Two male customers at supermarket checkout, one holding a credit card
prompts.negative_prompt: Single customers, unrelated store sections, digital-only payments.
